intro: Stillingia corniculata, commonly known as the hooked stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related species. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia corniculata is typically found in moist, shaded woodlands and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
